events.message: The customer reported a collision involving their car on the morning of February 28th, requesting to file an insurance claim for the damages incurred.
After reviewing the initial report, the claim was categorised under 'Auto Accident' due to the involvement of the insured vehicle in a collision.
A claims specialist was assigned to handle the case promptly and assist the customer throughout the process.
The insurance company officially acknowledged the receipt of the auto accident claim, confirming the start of the assessment procedure.
The claims agent requested a police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and repair estimates to proceed with the investigation.
The customer submitted all requested documents, including the police report and detailed photos of the collision site and vehicle damage.
The investigation team began verifying the claim details, cross-checking documentation and contacting involved parties for additional information.
The investigation concluded with confirmation that the collision was caused by the insured party's vehicle and damage assessment was completed.
The insurance company proposed a settlement amount to cover the repair costs of the insured vehicle, pending customer agreement.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and confirmed willingness to proceed with the repairs promptly.
Following customer confirmation, the claim was officially approved and repair authorization was issued to the approved service center.
The payment for the approved settlement amount was processed and transferred to the repair shop directly to cover all documented expenses.
The claim was closed successfully after confirmation that repairs were completed and the customer was satisfied with the outcome.
The complete claim file was archived in the system for record keeping and future reference if necessary.
